wikipedia_page.main:
James Robert Bain (1851 – 27 February 1913) was a British Conservative Party politician who represented Egremont, Cumberland in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom from 1900 to 1906.
He died at his home in London on 27 February 1913.

response: * Sir James Bain (Whitehaven MP) (1817–1898), Lord Provost of Glasgow, MP for Whitehaven 1891–2, founder of Whitehaven Ironworks
* James Bain (librarian) (1842–1908), Scottish-Canadian bookseller, publisher, and librarian
* James Bain (innocent prisoner) (born 1955), Florida, freed from prison after 35 years after DNA tests showed innocence
* James Bain (Egremont MP) (1851–1913), British Member of Parliament for Egremont, 1900–1906
* James Baine (1710–1790), minister of the Church of Scotland
